nodes.bodyText: added a nil check so it doesn't fail if the button isn't present
It seems that everything's nested within this clause. I'd suggest to just return if the button is null to keep the function flat.
Can you add a comment to this block to explain its intent?

I have no idea it's intent, I added an if block to safe guard against an undefined value, the rest of the changes are all indentation, you can see the changes without white space related changes showing my using this url:
https://github.com/jenkinsci/jenkins/pull/4479/files?utf8=%E2%9C%93&diff=split&w=1
Would it make sense to extract this <j:choose> to its own jelly template?

nodes.bodyText:
Any chance you could format this putting attributes in multiple lines, like on other inputs on this PR?
I'm also in favour of adding spacing within ternary operators. But maybe that's too much for this PR.

happy to format this

nodes.bodyText: Could Element.hasClassName(c,"negative")) || Element.hasClassName(c, "display-only-checked" be extracted into a variable? I think this conditional complicates the xor function a bit.

this isn't actually in use anymore, I need to revert it.
I was trying to not use the native controls and use icon's / images so that users don't get confused due to disabled controls not being that obvious.
But the javascript wasn't the easiest to change and I didn't want to break anything so I went back to using the native controls but forgot to revert this change
Most of the changes in this file are whitespace only.

This seems a weird choice of name given that both Extended Read and System Read use the term Read. I'm also more familiar with "read only" as a term.
Why was this term chosen?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,6 +30,15 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
 
   <l:layout norefresh="true" type="one-column" permission="${it.EXTENDED_READ}" title="${%Config(it.displayName)}">
 
+    <j:choose>
+      <j:when test="${app.hasPermission(it.CONFIGURE)}">
+        <j:set var="displayOnlyMode" value="false" />
+      </j:when>
+      <j:otherwise>
+        <j:set var="displayOnlyMode" value="true" />
